page.title: 03Villages 2 - Farms/Churches
page.content:
At the end of the village, near the pond if Great Bottom Farm. It has 132 acres and is smaller than Little Bottom Farm. Great Bottom Farm deals mainly with sheep and beef cattle, but it also has 45 geese. The owner breeds the geese every year for Christmas. Not only is thus very profitable, as geese eat anything but their feathers also sell for Â£1/lb.
Church- The vicar of Llanarth, Raymund Wilcox, has been here for 9 months and looks after 4 churches: Members St. David's, Llandewi Rhydderch 220 St. Teilo's, Llanarth 546 St. Cadric's, The Bryn 230 St. Bridget's, Llansantffraed 100
Parishes-Bentley 12000 Cotton and Blithfield 1000
